edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class Radar

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.GameObject
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.Radar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>

    public class Radar
extends GameObject
    This class gives the Radar the ability to show where the Room containing the briefcase is located on the Grid.
    Author:
    Kurt Newcomb, Andrew Nipp, Andrew Niklas, Ben Nickerson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int objID
      This field represents the unique ID of the object, used for comparing two GameObjects
      private java.lang.String RADAR
      This is the string for the name of the radar.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Radar()
      This is the constructor for the radar powerup which sets GameObject.setHiddenName(String) and GameObject.setObjectName(String) to RADAR and GameObject.getBlankName()
      Radar(boolean vis)
      This is the constructor for the radar powerup which sets GameObject.setHiddenName(String) and GameObject.setObjectName(String) to RADAR and GameObject.getBlankName() but with the visibly

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateRadar(Room bcRoom)
      This is the method that activates the radar powerup by calling Room.changeRoomState(boolean) and setting it to true
      void unactivateRadar(Room bcRoom)
      This is the method that deactivates the radar powerup by calling Room.changeRoomState(boolean) and setting it to false
